title: How to restore bookmarks after clean windows install
content:
Storage drive on my laptop got corrupted recently, So I got a new storage drive and installed windows on it. So I don't have any offline backup for my bookmarks. Is there any possibility that Firefox created any automatic cloud backup through which I can restore my bookmarks?

If not, how to setup automatic cloud backups for future.

Thank you
creator: shobitsharma01

title: Password manager extensions disappear OFTEN
content: It started with LastPass a few months ago. The extension would often, sometimes once per day, disappear from the toolbar and stop responding to login forms. To make it return, I would have to go into the extensions manager, disable it and re-enable right away. I thought it was just the LastPass extension and was gonna reach out to them. But then the hack was reported so I migrated to Dashlane. But now Dashlane is disappearing the same exact way. Every day. This happens with no other extensions, only LastPass a few months ago and Dashlane right now.
creator: prl77

title: Scroll position in Firefox's bookmarks keeps resetting to the top after updating to 110.0
content:
I've recently updated to version 110.0, and I immediately noticed an issue with my bookmarks where my scroll position in the bookmarks list isn't being saved after opening a tab or two. It keeps resetting back to the top of the list after a few seconds.

I don't know if this is a bug resulting from the latest update or what, but I know I didn't have this issue with bookmarks prior to updating to 110.0.
creator: FL2

title: I need ot download the xfinity app but google play stoe won't let me.

creator: thebewilderness

title: Having trouble with HTTPS Only Mode in latest version of Firefox 109.0.1
content:
Hello Gang - This problem has never occurred previously. Allow me to share --

Let me preface this question with a quick note: I use my Firefox Browser (V. 109.0.1) quite adequately and comfortably with the HTTPS Only mode set to "ON" all the time. (..thank you, btw..) To continue: I was recently sent a link from my antivirus company (Avast) for a discounted renewal for my account with them. This link was to a website called " digitalriver.com ". I was instructed by the sender that when using this link to access my 'discount', I would only have 1-Hour within which to complete my transaction or else the link would 'expire' and I would subsequently need to contact them once again for a 'new' link. "Not a problem!" I said to myself, as I confidently clicked the link and.. ..lo and behold, to my great surprise, when I clicked it, the site immediately threw up a 'security-window' (a 'frame' within the page) indicating that I could not access this site (the link) with my browser set to "HTTPS Only" mode. Somewhat miffed (and puzzled) I followed the included instructions on how to 'turn-off' this particular setting and yet once I did - Firefox immediately required me to "restart" the browser for this to take effect. Ultimately - this caused two issues... First, ..when i 'restarted' my Firefox browser, I lost my place in the page on "digitalriver.com", and was unable to 're-access' the link that I was sent.. ..and- Second, ..even though I have indeed changed my setting on the browser - all my pages still show up in the address-bar as "https://" rather than "http://" ...!?

Although I have sent an email to Avast regarding this issue, and hope for them to send me a New Link for the discount that was offered to me, I am troubled about how my browser has behaved since this time. I am also quite hesitant to do as suggested on Mozilla's help pages and - set my browser to "HTTPS Only" mode -but- adding an exception for this particular website, due to the instructions I received once I clicked on the link to 'digitalriver.com' which -again- stated explicitly to "turn-off" the HTTPS Only mode.

Please guys, what do you have to say about this particular dilemma I'm experiencing..?

Thank you in advance for your help,

Sincerely,

-Steven "Art" Slater 

                 .                             .
creator: ArtStud

title: How do I recover firefox(cache and cookies) ?
content:
I have not turn off the PC yet and just clear all the data last 2hours.

I tried this and it shows history only 1. Press Windows + R, type cmd and click OK. Or you can also type cmd in the Windows search bar. 2. Open Command Prompt, type ipconfig /displaydns, and press Enter. Now, you can see the recently visited websites. You can view, copy & paste the important websites into Firefox, and save them as bookmarks.

Why? because when login with rnc@#!3@!@gmail.com it ask for phone prompt again basically do not ask this device all gone!


I keep advice said when clearing cookies and cache all data will gone he say ok and proceed to regret please help.
